td.p:
File containing Netbeans-specific manifest entries. The plugin will automatically generate some of the entries:
OpenIDE-Module-Implementation-Version: <timestamp value in the format yyyyMMddhhmm> OpenIDE-Module: ${pom.package}/1 OpenIDE-Module-Specification-Version: ${pom.currentVersion}
If you define the entries in your manifest file, it will override these defaults.
Determines if the module is an autoload module or not.
A module cannot be both eager and autoload.
Determines if the module is an eager module or not.
A module cannot be both eager and autoload.
If true, the application will restart after installation of the module.
Location of the licence file to be included with the nbm.

If set to true, the plugin will generate default values for manifest attributes OpenIDE-Module-Display-Category, OpenIDE-Module-Name, OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description, OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description according to the values from POM.
Please note that using non-localized values is discouraged.
A property of dependency in the POM, if set to true, the plugin will include the dependency jar in the ext subdirectory.
For now, you have to add the Class-Path manifest entry for that file manually.

tr.td: Optional. Default value is not defined. If defined, then maven.nbm.manifest.bundle.include has to be defined as well.

td.p: Base folder where the nbm specific resources are expected. Currently is only used for including the Bundle.properties file into that jar that contains localized manifest entries.

table.tr:
maven.nbm.manifest.bundle.include Optional. Default value is not defined. If defined, then maven.nbm.manifest.bundle.basedir has to be defined as well.
Relative path to the Bundle.properties file including the name of the file.. Eg. org/mevenide/Bundle.properties
